parsers.coffee

Classes

  • BaseParser
  • CommonJSParser
  • RequireJSParser

Syntax tree parsers

These classes provide provide methods for extracting classes and functions from the CoffeeScript AST. Each parser class is specific to a module loading system (e.g. CommonJS, RequireJS), and should implement the getDependencies, getClasses and getFunctions methods. Parsers are selected via command line option.

Classes

BaseParser

This base class defines the interface for parsers. Subclasses should implement these methods.

Instance Methods

getDependencies(nodes)

Parse require statements and return a hash of module dependencies of the form:

{
    "local.name": "path/to/module"
}

getClasses(nodes)

Return an array of class nodes. Be sure to include classes that are assigned to variables, e.g. exports.MyClass = class MyClass

getFunctions(nodes)

Return an array of function nodes.

CommonJSParser

extends BaseParser

Parses code written according to CommonJS specifications:

require("module")
exports.func = ->

Instance Methods

getDependencies(nodes)

This currently works with the following require calls:

local_name = require("path/to/module")

or

local_name = require(__dirname + "/path/to/module")

getClasses(nodes)

getFunctions(nodes)

RequireJSParser

extends BaseParser

Not yet tested

Instance Methods

getNodes(nodes, debug)

_parseCall(node, deps)

Parse require([], ->) and define([], ->)

_parseAssign(node, deps)

Parse module = require("path/to/module")

_parseObject(node, deps)

Parse require = {}

_matchArgs(deps, mods, args)

Match the list of modules to the list of local variable names and add them to the dependencies object given.

_stripQuotes(str)

_parseFuncArgs(func)

Given a node of type 'Code', gathers the names of each of the function arguments and return them in an array.

_parseModuleArray(arr)

Given a node of type 'Arr', gathers the module paths represented by each object in the array and returns them in an array.

_getModulePath(mod)

getDependencies(nodes)

This currently works with the following require calls:

local_name = require("path/to/module")
local_name = require(__dirname + "/path/to/module")

The following require object assignments:

require = {deps: ["path/to/module"]}
require = {deps: ["path/to/module"], callback: (module) ->}

And the following require anddefine` calls:

require(["path/to/module"], (module) -> ...)
require({}, ["path/to/module"], (module) -> ...)
define(["path/to/module"], (module) -> ...)
define('', ["path/to/module"], (module) -> ...)

getClasses(nodes)

getObjects(nodes)

getFunctions(nodes)
